metadata.title: CVE-2012-4732 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Cross-site request forgery (CSRF) vulnerability in Request Tracker (RT)3.8.12 and other versions before 3.8.15, and 4.0.6 and other versionsbefore 4.0.8, allows remote attackers to hijack the authentication of usersfor requests that toggle ticket bookmarks.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-4732` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

request-tracker4 - 4.0.7-2
rt4-apache2 - 4.0.7-2
rt4-clients - 4.0.7-2
rt4-db-mysql - 4.0.7-2
rt4-db-postgresql - 4.0.7-2
rt4-db-sqlite - 4.0.7-2
rt4-fcgi - 4.0.7-2
rt4-standalone - 4.0.7-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: request-tracker4 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.0.7-2').
